doc.str: Apparatus and method for treating wastewater containing nitrogen-containing dyes

A wastewater treatment apparatus comprises a nitrogen-containing dye containing wastewater inlet connected to an obligatory anaerobic tank to bring wastewater containing a nitrogen-containing dye into contact with sulfate-reducing bacteria under obligatory anaerobic conditions, a nitrification tank to bring the wastewater into contact with nitrifying bacteria under aerobic conditions, and a denitrification tank to bring the wastewater into contact with the denitrifying bacteria under anaerobic conditions.

C. O'Neill, et al., Applied Microbiology and Biotechnology, vol. 53, No. 2, XP-002258475, pp. 249-254, "Azo-Dye Degradation in an Anaerobic-Aerobic Treatment System Operating on Simulated Textile Effluent", Feb. 2000. cited by other . | Jia Shengfu, et al. "The Properties of Decolorization of Dyes by Sulfate-Reducing Bacteria", Institute of Microbiology, Chinese Academy of Science, Beijing, Sep. 22, 2008. cited by other . | R. Krull, et al., Water Science and Technology, vol. 38, Issues 4-5, Abstract of "Combined Biological and Chemical Treatment of Highly Concentrated Residual Dyehouse Liquors", 1998. cited by other. | R. Krull, et al., Chemie Ingenieur Technik, vol. 72, No. 9, XP-002258473, pp. 1113-1114, "Konzept Zur Technischen Umsetzung Einer Zweistufigen Anoxischen Und Aeroben Textilabwasserbehandlung", 2000. cited by other . | A. Stolz, Applied Microbiology and Biotechnology, vol. 56, No. 1-2, XP-002258474, pp. 69-80, "Basic and Applied Aspects in the Microbial Degradation of Azo Dyes", Jul. 2001. cited by other .
SHIOTANI, TADAO | TAKAMI, YUKO | NAKAHARA, SEIICHI
